   "body_snippet": "## Expected Behavior\r\nWhen typing, single keypresses on dead keys should produce actual characters after being followed by another key.\r\n\r\n## Current Behavior\r\nContext: a VNC connection to a VM running on vSphere, through vSphere's builtin VNC server.\r\nDead keys produce no output, unless held for roughly 5 seconds, then the output doesn't stop anymore.\r\nFor reference, the same VNC connection through Guacamole works as intended.\r\n\r\n## Possible Solution\r\n\r\n## Steps to Reproduce (for bugs)\r\n1. Set ...",
-  "our_status": "new",
-  "priority": null,
+  "our_status": "triaged",
+  "priority": "P2-bug",
   "target_release": null,
   "our_branch": null,
   "our_pr": null,
-  "iterations": [],
+  "iterations": [
+    {
+      "seq": 1,
+      "date": "2026-02-20",
+      "type": "triaged",
+      "description": "VncSharpCore's ToAscii keyboard handling consumes dead key state from the Windows keyboard buffer, breaking compose sequences (accent + letter); the existing VncLockKeyFilter can be extended to intercept WM_DEADCHAR and compose the final character before sending the correct X11 keysym"
+    }
+  ],
   "comments": [],
   "comments_cursor": "2020-06-19T21:09:30Z",
   "unread_comments": 0,
   "needs_action": false,
   "waiting_for_us": false,
   "last_synced": "2026-02-15T09:52:50Z",
-  "notes": ""
+  "notes": "AI triage (claude): VncSharpCore's ToAscii keyboard handling consumes dead key state from the Windows keyboard buffer, breaking compose sequences (accent + letter); the existing VncLockKeyFilter can be extended to intercept WM_DEADCHAR and compose the final character before sending the correct X11 keysym\nApproach: Extend VncLockKeyFilter to intercept WM_DEADCHAR (0x0103) messages, store the dead key state, then on the subsequent WM_CHAR compose the final accented character and send the correct Unicode-to-X11-keysym via WriteKeyboardEvent, suppressing VncSharpCore's broken ToAscii path"
 }
